org.latency4j.util

Class StreamReadWriteUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.latency4j.util.StreamReadWriteUtilities

  • public final class StreamReadWriteUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

    A utility class for performing common stream-based I/O operations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.io.BufferedInputStream bufferStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
      Wraps the given stream with a BufferedInputStream if it is not already a BufferedInputStream.
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readLinesFromStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream, java.lang.String delimiter, int size)
      Reads the contents of the specified InputStream into a list of strings, where each string represents a line taken from the stream.
      static byte[] readStreamContentsAsBytes(java.io.InputStream inputStream)
      Reads the contents of the specified InputStream into a byte array.
      static byte[] readStreamContentsAsBytes(java.io.InputStream inputStream, boolean closeStream)
      Performs the same function as readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream), but allows the caller to indicate if the stream should be closed after its contents have been read.
      static byte[] readStreamContentsAsBytes(java.io.InputStream inputStream, int resourceSize)
      Reads the contents, up to the specified number of bytes, of an InputStream and returns the result as a byte array.
      static byte[] readStreamContentsAsBytes(java.io.InputStream inputStream, int resourceSize, boolean closeStream)
      Identical to readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream, int) other than it allows the caller to indicate if the stream should be closed after its contents have been read.

      Writes a data array to an output stream.
      static void writeBytesToStream(java.io.OutputStream outputStream, byte[] data, boolean closeStream)
      Performs the same function as writeBytesToStream(OutputStream, byte[]) but allows the caller to control if the stream is closed after it is written to.

    • Method Detail

      • readLinesFromStream

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> readLinesFromStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                                                   java.lang.String delimiter,
                                                                   int size)

        Reads the contents of the specified InputStream into a list of strings, where each string represents a line taken from the stream. The contents of the stream are tokenized into lines using the specified delimiter.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - The InputStream to be read and tokenized.
        delimiter - The end-of-line character to be applied to the InputStream.
        size - The maximum quantity of data to be read from the InputStream.
        Returns:
        A list of strings, where each string represents a line in the InputStream.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurred reading the InputStream.
        See Also:
        FileUtilities.readFileContentsAsBytes(File)

      • readStreamContentsAsBytes

        public static byte[] readStreamContentsAsBytes(java.io.InputStream inputStream)

        Reads the contents of the specified InputStream into a byte array. This method is similar to readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream, int), except that it does not allow the caller to specify the maximum number of bytes to be read. In essence, this method will attempt to read the entire contents of the stream.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - The InputStream to read.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the data read from the specified stream.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs while reading the contents of the specified stream.
        See Also:
        readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream, int), readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream, boolean)

      • readStreamContentsAsBytes

        public static byte[] readStreamContentsAsBytes(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                               boolean closeStream)

        Performs the same function as readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream), but allows the caller to indicate if the stream should be closed after its contents have been read.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - The InputStream to read.
        closeStream - A value of true will cause the stream to be closed after it is read, and false will achieve the opposite.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the data read from the specified stream.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs while reading the contents of the specified stream.
        See Also:
        readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream), readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream, int)

      • readStreamContentsAsBytes

        public static byte[] readStreamContentsAsBytes(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                               int resourceSize)

        Reads the contents, up to the specified number of bytes, of an InputStream and returns the result as a byte array.

        Unlike readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream) this method allows the caller to specify the maximum number of bytes to be read from the stream. As such, the quantity of data returned by this method never exceeds the maximum read size.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - The stream from which the data is to be read
        resourceSize - The amount of data to be read from the stream.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the data read from the InputStream.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs while reading data from the specified InputStream
        See Also:
        readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream)

      • readStreamContentsAsBytes

        public static byte[] readStreamContentsAsBytes(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                                               int resourceSize,
                                               boolean closeStream)

        Identical to readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream, int) other than it allows the caller to indicate if the stream should be closed after its contents have been read.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - The stream from which the data is to be read.
        resourceSize - The amount of data to be read from the stream.
        closeStream - A value of true will cause the stream to be closed after it is read, and false will achieve the opposite.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing the data read from the InputStream.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs while reading data from the specified InputStream.
        See Also:
        readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream, int), readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream), readStreamContentsAsBytes(InputStream, boolean)

      • writeBytesToStream

        public static void writeBytesToStream(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                                      byte[] data)

        Writes a data array to an output stream. Note that this method also closes and flushes the stream after writing to it.

        Parameters:
        outputStream - The destination OutputStream.
        data - The array to be written to the OutputStream.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs performing I/O operations against the stream.
        See Also:
        FileUtilities.writeBytesToFile(File, byte[]), FileUtilities.writeBytesToFile(File, byte[], boolean), FileUtilities.writeLinesToFile(File, List, String), IOResourceCloser.close(OutputStream)

      • writeBytesToStream

        public static void writeBytesToStream(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                                      byte[] data,
                                      boolean closeStream)

        Performs the same function as writeBytesToStream(OutputStream, byte[]) but allows the caller to control if the stream is closed after it is written to.

        Parameters:
        outputStream - The destination OutputStream.
        data - The array to be written to the OutputStream.
        closeStream - A value of true will cause the stream to be closed after the data is written to it, and false will achieve the opposite.
        Throws:
        Latency4JException - If an error occurs performing I/O operations against the stream.

      • bufferStream

        public static java.io.BufferedInputStream bufferStream(java.io.InputStream inputStream)

        Wraps the given stream with a BufferedInputStream if it is not already a BufferedInputStream.

        Parameters:
        inputStream - The stream to be wrapped with a BufferedInputStream.
        Returns:
        The given stream wrapped with a BufferedInputStream if the stream is not already an instance of that type. If the stream is a BufferedInputStream, this method just returns a reference to it.
